example.title: Revisiting Averaging Several Integers
example.para: Another method available from the Math class is the round method that rounds a floating point value to the nearest integer value. This method abstracts away some of the details of averaging we implemented in another example. Evaluating the expression average(5.9) yields the value 6 whereas evaluating the expression average(5.2) yields the value 5. Note that this is much easier to understand for a programmer than deciphering (int)(5.9 + 0.5) or (int)(5.2 + 0.5) which both perform the same rounding operation.
